channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Starlink in Brazil's crosshairs as spat over Elon Musk's X escalates
item.description: The confrontation between Brazil and Musk continues to escalate over the country's decision to block his social media company X.

item.title: Mongolia was meant to arrest Russia's President Putin last night. It didn't, and now it's in trouble
item.description: Mongolia, as a member of the International Criminal Court, should have arrested the Russian president as soon as he landed on Mongolian soil Monday evening.

item.title: Rolls-Royce shares rebound 4% after Cathay Pacific says A350 engine issue affects limited flights
item.description: Cathay Pacific has identified an engine component failure in 15 of its A350 aircraft, a long-range, wide-body which uses Rolls-Royce engines.

item.title: Russia signals its official stance on using nuclear weapons is about to change, accusing the West of 'escalation'
item.description: Russia has again hinted that it is making changes to its official policy on the use of nuclear weapons, as Ukraine's incursion into the Kursk region continues.

item.title: China's property woes and U.S. sanctions have hit some cities hard
item.description: Hangzhou, capital of the eastern Zhejiang province and home to Alibaba and other tech companies, ranked first in this year's rankings.

item.title: First France, now South Korea — Telegram's legal troubles are only growing. Here's why
item.description: Telegram is facing a probe in South Korea, where police suspect it of helping spread illicit deepfake porn, adding to the platform's mounting legal troubles.

item.title: JPMorgan economist says China's housing market crash is still not over
item.description: China's troubled housing market could see prolonged softness, as a slew of government stimulus and supportive measures have not been "satisfactory."

item.title: Chinese consumer brands look to crack the global market with Singapore as a testbed
item.description: Chinese consumer brands are using Singapore as a cultural testbed in their push to build an international business.

item.title: China's first global gaming hit sells millions in a week. An early investor shares what's next
item.description: China's first attempt at a top-tier video game has smashed world records, bolstering the industry's global ambitions after Beijing's gaming crackdown.

item.title: Why does Couche-Tard want to buy 7-Eleven? It's a 'cheap' stock, says portfolio manager
item.description: There is little to improve in Seven & i's core business, but the company is cheaper than global counterparts, Comgest's Kaye said.

item.title: 'Golden era' for Hong Kong retail is over as Chinese tourists continue to tighten their purse strings
item.description: Real estate analysts claimed that the shopping frenzy the city once experienced will not return "for a long, long time."

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly fall after South Korea's inflation rate hits 42-month low
item.description: South Korea's headline inflation for August eased to 2% form 2.6%, its lowest level since March 2021

item.title: Huawei looks to upstage Apple with product launch just hours after expected iPhone 16 unveiling
item.description: It's unclear what Huawei plans to launch, but the company's consumer and automotive technology executive Richard Yu, called it an "epoch-making product."

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Bitcoin isn’t really a currency (yet)
item.description: In my head, bitcoin is pretty pebbles exchanged among enthusiasts. But no one's really using it to buy other goods.

item.title: Is the Fed 'sleepwalking into a policy mistake?': Abrdn analyst calls for faster easing of rates
item.description: Is the economy already weaker than the headline data suggests and should the U.S. Federal Reserve already be easing? Akintewe questioned on "Squawk Box Asia."

item.title: Has Boeing shaken your confidence to fly? A new MIT study could restore it
item.description: Boeing's ongoing quality control issues have rattled traveler confidence. But a new study from MIT says flying is getting safer by the decade.

item.title: American demand for international trips drives 'travel momentum' and overall spending
item.description: Americans' spending on international trips has underpinned overall travel strength.

item.title: Weight loss drugs cut Covid-19 deaths, study finds
item.description: Fewer deaths and negative health outcomes were identified in patients with chronic kidney disease and who caught Covid-19 after treatment with semaglutide.

item.title: UK suspends some arms export licenses to Israel
item.description: British Foreign Minister David Lammy said Monday that the country would immediately suspend some arms export licenses to Israel.

item.title: Germany's fragile coalition dealt fresh blow as far right lands first state win since World War II
item.description: After Germany's far-right AfD recorded successes in state elections, the path ahead could be tricky for the national government around Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

item.title: BYD sales hit a record in August despite broader China EV slowdown
item.description: Chinese electric car giant BYD sold a record number of passenger vehicles in August, with sales of hybrids growing faster than those of battery-only cars.

item.title: Macao did it. Singapore too. Now Thailand looks to build casinos to attract tourist dollars
item.description: If the law gets passed, Thailand could be Macao and Singapore's largest competitor by the end of the decade, industry watchers told CNBC.

item.title: Nationwide strikes erupt in Israel as hostage deaths kindle pressure for cease-fire deal
item.description: Israel's largest labor union called a general strike on Monday, amid rising pressure on Benjamin Netanyahu's government to clinch a cease-fire deal.

item.title: Volkswagen warns of plant closures in Germany, citing ‘extremely tense’ situation
item.description: Volkswagen on Monday warned it will no longer be able to rule out plant closures in Germany.

item.title: China's manufacturing output swung back to modest growth in August, private survey finds
item.description: China's factory activity has shown modest growth among smaller manufacturers, as exporting orders offset the weakening domestic consumption.

item.title: X blocked in Brazil after supreme court panel upholds suspension order
item.description: A panel of Brazil's federal supreme court justices voted unanimously to uphold orders suspending the use of Elon Musk's social network X nationwide there.

item.title: Rupert Murdoch's property group considers bid for UK's Rightmove, sending shares 21% higher
item.description: Rupert Murdoch-owned REA Group said Monday it is contemplating a takeover offer for U.K. property portal Rightmove in a bid to create a global digital real estate business.

item.title: The peak interest rate era is over. Here's what investors are watching
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is about to join the European Central Bank, the Bank of England, the People's Bank of China and others in cutting key rates.

item.title: Here’s how much athletes at the Paris Paralympics earn for winning medals
item.description: While the International Paralympic Committee does not dole out prize money for winning medals, several countries do reward their athletes with medal bonuses.

item.title: Defense stocks in an ESG portfolio? A profound — and controversial — shift seems to be underway
item.description: The idea of including defense stocks in sustainably-minded portfolios remains controversial.
